Receiver¶

class simulate.agent.receiver.Receiver(agent)¶

Bases: object

Handles receiving messages from speakers, interpreting statements, and updating the receiver’s beliefs and friendships.

compute_trust(topic: int, speaker: int, statement: Info, blush: bool) → float¶

Computes the trustworthiness of the speaker based on the received statement.

Parameters:

  • topic (int) – The topic of conversation.

  • speaker (int) – The ID of the speaker.

  • statement (Info) – The statement received from the speaker.

  • blush (bool) – Indicates if the speaker is blushing.

Returns:

The computed trust value.

Return type:

float

handle_surprise(statement: Info, topic: int) → float¶

Calculates the surprise factor based on the received statement and topic.

Parameters:

  • statement (Info) – The statement received from the speaker.

  • topic (int) – The topic of conversation.

Returns:

The computed surprise factor.

Return type:

float

interprete_speaker(speaker: int, topic: int, statement: Info) → dict¶

Interprets the information about the speaker based on the statement.

Parameters:

  • speaker (int) – The ID of the speaker.

  • topic (int) – The topic of conversation.

  • statement (Info) – The statement received from the speaker.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the interpreted information about the speaker’s truth and lies.

Return type:

dict

interprete_topic(speaker: int, topic: int, statement: Info) → dict¶

Interprets the information about the topic based on the statement.

Parameters:

  • speaker (int) – The ID of the speaker.

  • topic (int) – The topic of conversation.

  • statement (Info) – The statement received from the speaker.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the interpreted information about truth and lies.

Return type:

dict

receive(topic: int, speaker: int, statement: Info, blush: bool) → dict¶

Processes a received statement, updates trust, and interprets the speaker and topic.

Parameters:

  • topic (int) – The topic of conversation.

  • speaker (int) – The ID of the speaker.

  • statement (Info) – The statement received from the speaker.

  • blush (bool) – Indicates if the speaker is blushing.

Returns:

A dictionary containing trust and interpreted information about the speaker and topic.

Return type:

dict
